page.title: 15LEISURE AND RECREATION
page.content: Guardbridge has two clubs, the youth club for young people, and the sports and social club for adults. The sports and social club is attended by 1200 members who make use of the facilities - pool tables, darts, dominoes and bingo. The youth club unfortunately is in danger of closing down because of the poor attendance of only 30 members. The feeling of the children was that it did not provide enough facilities for them. There are also riding stables, one has 34 horses. Trecking costs Â£2.50 for children under 12 and Â£3.00 for adults. They get a lot of holiday makers going out during the week days. They lease horses for Â£600 per year, at the moment they have 6 leases. They feed their horses on beet pulp, oats, barley, mixed feed and pony nuts they get from local suppliers.
